The importance of the smart site in the decision-making process 

The smart site is a term that is basically related to the smart map through geographical databases and the possibility of modifying it and addition because of the flexibility of the map, it is easy to modify the paths of roads to meet a specific service and it is the beginning of the correct path for good planning. 

Objective and thought: Goal setting is the cornerstone of the decision-making process, since the right decision is originally based on the goal, so decisions, budget, economics, and decision implementation differ depending on the goal. 

The idea is the other side of the goal, the idea arises from the presence of a problem or crisis and how to manage it in the most appropriate way. Site value: The value of the site varies from one site to another according to its data, the sites that have rivers and a road network are the most attractive sites for activities and services and thus the return from them increases. 

Decision-making process: It is the last stage after studying the location data and geographical database and summarizing this in written reports to take the appropriate decision. 

Building models: Adopting site simulation models for crisis management and problem solutions through geographical databases, remote sensing and area (geomatics science), the process of converting paper to digitization is the essence of the topic.

There was more experiences in decision make:

 

  • Saudi Arabia experience in decision make: Problem is water rare and recycling waste water 
  • USA experience in decision make: Problem is reduce of potato production in farms and make solutions to manage situation. 
  • FAO project on climate changes global warming effects on human activities, the problem is climate and high rise in temperature and sea level rise.
